DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study determine whether repetitive transcranial magnetic stimulation ( rTMS ) effective remediate cognitive deficit also improve functionality Veterans schizophrenia .
DOC.brief_title: Improving Neurocognitive Deficits Function Schizophrenia With Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation
DOC.detailed_description: High-frequency , repetitive transcranial magnetic stimulation ( rTMS ) dorsolateral prefrontal cortex ( DLPFC ) , dysfunctional brain region implicate cognitive deficit schizophrenia , recently show improve cognition non-Veteran sample schizophrenia . The investigator ' goal confirm efficacy treatment modality remediate cognitive deficit improve functionality Veterans schizophrenia , well gain good understand neural mechanism responsible cognitive deficit remediation . The investigator propose conduct small-scale study generate pilot data support feasibility conduct rTMS Veterans effectiveness rTMS population . In addition , investigator conduct neurophysiologic experiment test whether certain neural maker abnormal brain function improve rTMS .
DOC.criteria: SCID confirm diagnosis Schizophrenia Schizoaffective Disorder Stable medication regimen ( change dose agent within 2 week prior study entry throughout duration study ) Stable social environment housing enable regular attendance clinic visit Ability undergo cognitive testing , EEG scan rTMS IQ > 80 ( WASI full scale score ) In general good medical health Is treatment psychiatrist and/or primary care physician within VHA system Pregnant lactate female History prior adverse reaction TMS On medication know significantly low seizure threshold , e.g . : clozapine chlorpromazine buproprion clomipramine History seizures condition know substantially increase risk seizure Implants medical device incompatible TMS Acute unstable chronic illness would affect participation compliance study procedure , e.g . : unstable angina Substance abuse/dependence ( include caffeine nicotine ) within onemonth period prior study entry study participation Unstable psychiatric symptom preclude consistent participation study , e.g . : active current suicidal intent plan severe psychosis History loss consciousness great 15 minute due head injury . Participation another concurrent clinical trial Patients prior exposure rTMS Have mass lesion , cerebral infarct active central nervous system disease , history traumatic brain injury
